    • Method Detail

      • parseDBparams

        public static void parseDBparams(java.lang.String arg)
        Parse a String that is formed host/port/user/pw/dbname for Postgres or h2:... for H2. Assign to connection set #0
        Parameters:
        arg - the access string

      • parseDBparams

        public static void parseDBparams(java.lang.String arg,
                                 int set)
        Parse a String that is formed host/port/user/pw/dbname for Postgres or h2:... for H2. Assign to a certain connection set (0..2).
        Parameters:
        arg - the access string
        set - one of 0...2

        Parameters:

        Returns:

      • getConnection

        public static java.sql.Connection getConnection()
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Get a database Connection object. parseDBparams has to be called first. Config set #0 ist used.
        Returns:
        the connection instance to access the database
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the database is not accessible

      • getConnection

        public static java.sql.Connection getConnection(int set)
                                         throws java.lang.Exception
        Get a database Connection object. parseDBparams has to be called first.
        Parameters:
        set - one of 0...2
        Returns:
        the connection instance to access the database
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception - if the database is not accessible

        col BETWEEN x1 AND x2 OR col BETWEEN y1 AND y2 col BETWEEN z1 AND Z2  ...

      • sqlFromIntervals

        public static java.lang.String sqlFromIntervals(java.lang.String colName,
                                                java.util.ArrayList<int[]> intervals)
                                         throws java.lang.IllegalArgumentException
        Compute an SQL condition 
        col BETWEEN x1 AND x2 OR col BETWEEN y1 AND y2 col BETWEEN z1 AND Z2  ...
        Parameters:
        colName - the database column name
        intervals - list of intervals (int[2], where [0]=from, [1]=to)
        Returns:
        the sql string
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException

      • limitVarchar

        public static java.lang.String limitVarchar(java.lang.String text,
                                            int maxLength,
                                            boolean wording)
        Limit a String to put into a VARCHAR field with limited length. If the String is longer, it will be cut and "..." is appended.
        Parameters:
        text - a string
        maxLength - max length
        wording - if true, the method avoids to cut inside words
        Returns:
        the text maybe cut
